polarize verb [T]
(DIVIDE)
to cause something, especially something that contains different people or opinions, to divide into two completely opposing groups: The issue has polarized the nation. Two developments have polarized the debate.

polarize verb [T]
(LIGHT)
physics
  specialized to make light waves move in one direction only, or mainly in one direction: To polarize the light there is a screen directly in front of the projector. A polarizing filter is a filter which transmits only light polarized in a specific dimension.
to treat glass with a substance that reduces the amount of reflected light: Car manufacturers do not polarize the glass in windscreens for safety reasons.
